byline.original: By REED ABELSON and MARGOT SANGER-KATZ

abstract: The Upshot; analysis indicates 17 percent of Americans eligible for health insurance under Affordable Care Act plan may only have one insurer to choose in 2017; trend is due to wave of insurer failures and decisions by largest companies to exit markets.

headline.print_headline: For Some on Health Exchanges, Only One Plan to Choose
headline.main: Obamacare Options? In Many Parts of Country, Only One Insurer Will Remain

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

snippet: Plan failures and the recent decision by some of the largest companies to exit markets are leaving large areas of the country with functional monopolies....
lead_paragraph: Plan failures and the recent decision by some of the largest companies to exit markets are leaving large areas of the country with functional monopolies.
